resources.string: You must grant this app access to your location before we can easily find you on the map!\n\n Hit "OK" to grant this app permission.
Unable to obtain location. Make sure Location is enabled in Settings.
Required Google Play Location services unavailable.
Location is not enabled. Cancelling request...
Unable to start request for location. Please open settings and enable location services.
There was an error connecting to Google Play Services.
Location found, but may not be very accurate.
Location service time-out after 10 seconds. Could not get a location lock!
Please enter an address to search.
Search result found. Zooming to address.
Error using Google services. Please try again later.
You must be connected to the internet to use this application.
Please connect to the internet to use search.
Please connect to the internet to use location.
Due to limitations with Google Maps, you may want to zoom more to fill the screen with the building of interest.\n\nWould you like to zoom more?
Please enter a name for this heatmap.
You will not be able to undo this action. Are you sure you want to delete this heatmap?
You must connect to wifi to use this application. Please come back when you have connected to WiFi.
You must enable wifi to use this application. Please come back when you have enabled WiFi.
Error sharing image. Please try again!
You do not have a wifi connection.
Loading your heatmap....\n\nThis may take a few seconds, please be patient.
The data for your heatmap seems to be missing...\n\n
When completed, hit the next button in the bottom right.
When completed, hit the save button in the bottom right.
Hide this help screen by default.
(This screen can be accessed by pressing the help button in the upper right)
You have not added any heatmaps.\n\nClick the plus button to create one.

Find the location of the building that you want to map by searching an address or using your current location.\n\n Zoom, pan, and rotate to fill the screen as much as possible with the building of interest.
Zoom, pan, and rotate to fill the screen as much as possible with the building of interest.
Place your finger on the screen where you are located in the location.\n\n Walk around slowly while moving your finger along the path you\'re walking around the location.
Amazing, max achievable signal strength. The client can only be a few feet from the AP to achieve this. Not typical or desirable in the real world.
Very good, minimum signal strength for applications that require very reliable, timely delivery of data packets. (VoIP, video streaming)
Okay, minimum signal strength for reliable packet delivery. (Email, web)
Not good, minimum signal strength for basic connectivity. Packet delivery may be unreliable.
Unusable, approaching or drowning in the noise floor. Any functionality is highly unlikely.
